poem:
"Of Age and Uncertainty"

In the hubbub of Virginia's air, confusion,
Trump embraces a speech like a labyrinth - 
Through hazel eyes, Obama wears Biden's face.
Age, an unwelcome jester, plays its tricks,
On gray fields, where dreams tangle with realities,
Silvered heads aloft, like a string of forgotten truths, 
Observe nameless birds perched on the wire of Presidency.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump confuses Obama for Biden again at Virginia rally speech Donald Trump confused Barack Obama for Joe Biden at a rally in Virginia on Saturday, triggering further questions about the age of the likely Republican presidential nominee who has made a string of such gaffes. It also comes at a time of similar concerns about the Biden. At 77 and 81 respectively, Trump and Biden are the oldest people to run for the presidency in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
